subject: Re: get junit result for every testXXX
msgSnippet: Yes, but I don t know how to use it. The only class that has a addListener(TestListener) method is class TestResult, which in turn will be used by TestCase.
messageBody:
Yes, but I don't know how to use it. The only class that has
a "addListener(TestListener)" method is class TestResult, which in turn
will be used by TestCase. Is this means, I have to code JDBC and XML
parsing (I use XML for grade matching) for every testXXX method? That
is absolutely not the one I'd like to do. I prefer write a simple,
usual code for JUnit, and write the complex code for grade matching in
my grading tool program (in button ActionListener perhaps). So what
should i do?

>
> Have you looked at the TestListener?
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
> but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
> the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
> me, and gave himself for me."
> Galatians 2:20
